p.s: Attenborough's salutation in his speech involves altering his current audience, consisting of a room full of powerful politicians from several different countries, putting them on an even higher pedestal than they already are.
That way he emphasizes their responsibility of choices they make.
And calling this group of people excellencies and delegates (l. 1) is his way of letting them know to act accordingly and reasonable to this title.

In the paragraph from line 7 to line 16 he uses the illusion of a stable climate being the fundamental resource and reason why humanity was able to become a civilization and could evolve to the modernised lifestyle we pursue at this day and age.
And now this stability is breaking (l. 16) througthrough globalisation.

His line of argument in this section is comparable to the saying do not bite the hand that feeds you, which is also fitting in line 35 to 36 where he personifies nature itself as a key ally that helps us.
Attenborough tries to create a positive mindset of being able to recover the climate through several stylistic devices.
In line 28 for example, he uses an alliteration to emphasize that part of the sentence which is to turn this tragedy into a triumph.
Right after that he makes use of the anapher and starting the next five sentences with We.
With that he is also able to unify the listeners and speaking to them directly, with the intention of them feeling more obligated to act.

This use of the word we is continuislycontinuously used througoutthroughout the rest of the speech, showing that Sir Attenborough cans on the effect of creating a sense of unity amongst people, to get them to take action.
In his final sentences of his speech he asks a question revolving around if the numbers of the carbon concentration will drop, because of decisions that I made at the COP26.
AlthougAlthough he states being positive about this, the question is clearly left unanswered, as its result lies in the future.
This way he emphasizes on the importance and weight of this confidence and furthermore gives the individual the feeling of actually being able to define the answer to that question.
Taking everything into account the hypothesis stated at the beginning of this analysis is proven to be correct.

An additional conclusion about the authorsauthor's attempt to convince his audience is that he uses positive conotatedconnotated phrases and words of affirmation to ensure his audience hope of recovery but simultaneously unifies the audience by sayinsaying that we are able to make a change.
